definition: to show respect for/to think highly of
to see/to look at/to read/to watch/to visit/to call on/to consider/to regard as/to look after/to treat (an illness)/to depend on/to feel (that)/(after verb) to give it a try/Watch out! (for a danger)
to look after/to take care of/to watch/to guard
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group

sentences.english: It is a great honor to be looked up to by someone.
sentences.chinese: 被某人看得起是一项很大的荣耀。

sentences.english: Jim, 'he said, 'you're the only person here worth anything .
sentences.chinese: “吉姆，”他说，这里我只看得起你一个人。

sentences.english: R in this society, want others to think highly of you is to rely on the strength of the.
sentences.chinese: 在这个社会，要别人看得起你是靠实力的。

sentences.english: Eg. In the old society, who would look up to us?
sentences.chinese: 旧社会谁还会看得起我们？

sentences.english: Other people are willing to challenge you, that's because you have the strength that they think highly of.
sentences.chinese: 别人愿意跟你挑战，是因为你有别人看得起的长处。

sentences.english: In the old society, who would look up to us?
sentences.chinese: 在旧社会谁还会看得起我们？

sentences.english: Begin by thinking highly of yourself and your decision-making process.
sentences.chinese: 要看得起自己，以及整个决定的过程。

sentences.english: You will never recommend yourself to his friend by so doing.
sentences.chinese: 你这样做，他的朋友也不会看得起你的。

sentences.english: Foreigners are not highly of you.
sentences.chinese: 外国人是不会看得起你的。

definition: to lift sth up/to elevate sb/to honor sb (with compliments, gifts, promotions etc)/to show great regard/to speak highly/Taiwan pr. [tai2 ju3]
to look down upon/to hold in contempt
to look down upon/to despise
fail to appreciate sb's kindness/not know how to appreciate favors
to attach importance to sth/to value
to belittle/to scorn/to take sth lightly
unable to tell good from bad (idiom)/undiscriminating
knowing oneself (idiom)/self-knowledge
to show deference or praise publicly
to speak seriously/to exaggerate
to bother/to press sb, usu. to do sth/it's a tough job/sorry to bother you (polite, used to thank sb for a favor)
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
to regard sb as an outsider
to overestimate one's capabilities
to distrust/to be suspicious
ugly/shameful/to ridicule
